the-greedy-tank.name: The Greedy Tank
the-greedy-tank.description: A small game about resource gathering made during the Frima game jam

tlou-spot-picking.name: The last of us : Spot picking system
tlou-spot-picking.description: Show delay-gather and time-slice optimization techniques in C++. Based on articles by Naughty Dog developer 'Ming-Lun Allen Chou'

harmless-delivery.name: (H)armless Delivery
harmless-delivery.description: Mix golf and quick action logic in this small game made for the LudumDare 53

links.video: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/sGcepL4PMeE?si=3NxB_ww6MZZRT1gI" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

sparks-of-hope.name: Mario + Rabbids : Sparks of Hope
sparks-of-hope.description: A Turn-based action RPG made by Ubisoft on Switch. I was in the Tools team improving the Snowdrop engine in C++

links.video: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FN48p_QXBUk?si=xBJzuqzDuWOcfp_F" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

open-engine.name: Open 3D Engine
open-engine.description: A free AAA game engine built from the source code of Amazon Lumberyard. I help with editor-related issues in my spare time

links.video: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/CQmjAxr7LZs?si=QYfldEu1tG1_Utkp" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

sakari.name: Sakari
sakari.description: Unity3D puzzle game in 3rd person based on a time-rewind mechanic

links.video: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MTUfCKjPvsM?si=UHJCDH_vphG87Qfu" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

universe-engine.name: Universe Engine
universe-engine.description: I worked on the in-house game engine of Virtual Arts during an internship. My goal was to improve performance and fix rendering bugs with their Metal and Vulkan implementations

links.video: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/LGJxlQbkPa4?si=gSF-dIoQAmiKCv_3" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

scanrig.name: ScanRig
scanrig.description: ScanRig is a tool built with AliceVision to achieve high-quality photogrammetry at low-budget. You place your object in the center, and 3 cameras will turn around and take pictures of it

links.video: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/411076799?h=91f6cac3e9&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

chaos-dashboard.name: Chaos Dashboard
chaos-dashboard.description: A data-visualisation website about the worst kind of events of the year. There are little games, demons and all sort of jokes. This nightmare-ish design was integrated with React

the-last-call.name: The Last Call
the-last-call.description: A title sequence for an original movie. I modelled and textured the robot, and took Megascan assets in Unreal Engine for the universe. We took some motion-capture animations from Mixamo and applied modifications to them

links.video: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/421542604?h=f8f1c9fcec&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

snowpiercer.name: A Snowpiercer Scene
snowpiercer.description: A small scene made with Blender about the Snowpiercer movie. It is rendered in realtime to try out the power of the Evee renderer

links.video: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/384904687?h=43f4793a6f&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

learn-vulkan.name: Learn Vulkan
learn-vulkan.description: A custom renderer made to learn and test Vulkan concepts. It uses a lot of Object-Oriented-Programming to better understand the relationship between vulkan objects

cube-beast-editor.name: Cube Beast Editor
cube-beast-editor.description: A voxel-editor running on your desktop and your browser. The renderer is OpenGL, but it builds in WebAssembly which converts calls to WebGL

links.video: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ufIPoiNyozU?si=r79E7ZHK_uY-BxAm" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

met-ecs.name: Met ECS
met-ecs.description: An Entity-Component-System library in C++ made to test out the templating langage. Its API is based on the entt library to compare performance easily

mirrors-lasers-robots.name: Mirrors Lasers & Robots
mirrors-lasers-robots.description: A small tower-defense game with made in C++ with an Entity Component System architecture. It renders with OpenGL but we use Microsoft's XAML through Noesis GUI for the user interface

links.video: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/385595523?h=3a0c9d2316&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

opengl-playground.name: OpenGL Playground
opengl-playground.description: A simple OpenGL renderer with an Entity Component System architecture. Can run on your browser as it support WebAssembly builds

dx11-playground.name: DirectX 11 Playground
dx11-playground.description: A simple DirectX 11 renderer with an Entity Component System architecture

links.video: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ibX6sLMKhQI?si=en721UyYvDFp_KaK" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

coffee-conspiration.name: Coffee Conspiration
coffee-conspiration.description: A parody website built with webpack and HTML Components. It is a game/story experience dedicated to surprise its audience and play with conspiration tropes

portal-box.name: Portal Box
portal-box.description: A puzzle-box built when I applied for my engineering school. You have to resolve a combination with two potentiometer in order to open the box

links.video: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/267103924?h=c37aca13cc&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

echoppe-ben.name: L'échoppe de Ben
echoppe-ben.description: Point'n click game made with Unity for the Digital Art Jam 2. You visit the small chop made by the Artist Ben Vautier and try to discover its secrets

links.video: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/l3e-1zdfMJc?si=pAqoIXdEvfsfHvmn" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

infotrafic.name: Infotrafic.com
infotrafic.description: A realtime-trafic map visualizer made for my employer Infotrafic. It is built with Angular and uses Node.js as backend. Uses progressive web app (PWA) structure and conventions

links.video: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WLJl8z3pVHY?si=GBxvpnhnLeYntmn0" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

kanaga-wave.name: Kanaga Wave
kanaga-wave.description: A 1 vs 1 game made in Unity during the Global Game Jam 2017. You have to jump in rythm to make big waves in order to overflow your opponent on the other island
